data.title: East Tennessee Veterans Memorial Association — Davidson, Tommy
data.text:
Tommy Davidson was born in Pennsylvania around 1922 to Grover Cleveland Davidson and Florence Snow. He enlisted on 13 January 1943 at Fort Oglethorpe in Georgia. He was killed in action in 1944 in France.

The Chattanooga Times, December 8, 1947

Whitwell, Tenn., Dec. 7 –Funeral services for Pfc. Thomas W. (Tommy) Davidson, 18, who died in a hospital in France on Aug. 2, 1944, will be held at the Whitwell Church of Christ. He was the son of Mr. and Mrs. Grover C. Davidson.

Survivors, his parents; two sisters, Mrs. Geneva Brumlow of Detroit, Michigan and Mrs. Jobyna Jones, Whitwell; seven brothers, Pearl of Monteagle; Harold, James, Floyd, Paul, Bob and Grover Jr., all of Whitwell.

Rank: Private

Date of birth:

2 October 1922

Date of death: 4 August 1944

County: Marion

Hometown: Whitwell

Service Branch: Army/Army Air Forces

Theater: Europe

Conflict: World War II

Awards: Purple Heart

Burial/Memorial Location: Red Hill Cemetery Whitwell, Marion County, Tennessee

Location In Memorial: Pillar XV, Middle Panel
